description.long: Neuschwanstein Castle, commissioned by King Ludwig II of Bavaria, is a 19th-century Romanesque Revival palace known for its picturesque setting and inspiration for Disney's Sleeping Beauty Castle.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.long: The Brandenburg Gate is a neoclassical triumphal arch and one of Germany's most famous landmarks, symbolizing unity and peace after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.long: Cologne Cathedral is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the largest cathedrals in Europe. Its twin spires and stunning stained glass windows make it a must-visit attraction.

image.alt: Cologne Cathedral with its twin spires

description.long: Marienplatz is the heart of Munich and a vibrant meeting place. It features the historic New Town Hall and the famous Glockenspiel show.

image.alt: Marienplatz with the New Town Hall in Munich
image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A scenic region with castles and vineyards.
description.long: The Romantic Rhine stretches between Koblenz and Bingen and features charming villages, historic castles, and beautiful landscapes along the Rhine River.

image.alt: The Romantic Rhine with castles and vineyards

description.short: A UNESCO site in Essen showcasing industrial heritage.
description.long: The Zollverein Coal Mine is a striking example of industrial architecture and a symbol of Germany's coal and steel production history. It houses museums and cultural spaces.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A cultural city with a rich history.
description.long: Weimar is famous for its association with Goethe and Schiller, as well as the Bauhaus movement. It features museums, historic sites, and a vibrant arts scene.

description.short: A stunning island with chalk cliffs and beaches.
description.long: Rügen Island, located in the Baltic Sea, is known for its dramatic chalk cliffs, sandy beaches, and Jasmund National Park.

description.short: A vast urban park in Munich.
description.long: The English Garden is one of the largest city parks in the world, featuring open green spaces, a Japanese tea house, and the iconic Chinese Tower beer garden.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication

description.short: A small, ornate palace in Bavaria.
description.long: Linderhof Palace is a rococo-style royal villa built by King Ludwig II. It is surrounded by beautiful gardens, fountains, and parkland.

image.license: Creative Commons Zero, Public Domain Dedication
